Generation I.Red: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
Generation I.Yellow: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
Generation I.Stadium: Its shell is so hard, it can even withstand a bomb. No one has ever seen what is inside its shell.

Generation II.Gold: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
Generation II.Silver: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
Generation II.Crystal: Even a missile can't break the spikes it uses to stab opponents. They're even harder than its shell.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pok é mon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
Generation III.Sapphire: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pok é mon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
Generation III.Emerald: It swims in the sea by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. The Cloyster shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
Generation III.FireRed: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

Generation IV.Diamond: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
Generation IV.Pearl: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
Generation IV.Platinum: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

Generation VI.X: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
Generation VI.Y: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.

Generation VII.Sun: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
Generation VII.Moon: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon's shell.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: If areas of Cloyster's very hard shell get damaged, those areas swell, gradually growing into large sharp spikes.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Slowpoke tails are its favorite food. It has even been known to come up on land to look for Slowpoke from time to time.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamond shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamond shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
